Welcome

What is ProDy for:

ProDy is designed to facilitate flexible and rapid exploitation of the ever growing protein structural data in the study of protein dynamics.

ProDy is a fast, flexible and powerful Python package designed for protein structural dynamics analysis. ProDy is developed by Ahmet Bakan and licensed under the GPLv3.

New features and functions are being constantly added to ProDy package. The following are the main features that are present and working fine:

  • Protein structure analysis:
    • parse PDB files quickly
    • access subsets of atoms with the powerful and sophisticated atom selector
    • automatically find similar/matching chains and compare, e.g. calculate RMSD, get deformation vector
    • measure quantities, such as distances, radius of gyration, etc.
  • Elastic Network Models (ENMs): perform Anisotropic/Gaussian Network models (ANM/GNM) analysis of proteins
  • Principal Component Analysis (PCA): analyze ensembles of X-ray structures, NMR models, or molecular dynamics trajectories (also known as Essential Dynamics Analysis or EDA)
  • Comparative Normal Mode Analysis (NMA): functions for comparing different models and plotting data
